Sidebar

  • Usage guidelines
  • Basic Sidebar
  • Narrow version
  • Narrow with icons
  • Off-canvas filters

Usage Guidelines

The sidebar is a secondary navigation pattern, typically used to provide navigation links to sub-pages in a complex navigation hierarchy or to different views in an application dashboard.

Do

  • Provide links to 2nd or 3rd tier of navigation structure
  • Use consistently between sibling pages
  • Present secondary controls, such as a contextual form or set of controls (e.g. query filters)

Don't

  • Use as primary navigation (use navbar instead)
  • Use as an alternative to a modal or dialog

Basic sidebar

The sidebar component is fixed to the left side of the page and will automatically scroll if its contents go beyond the viewport height.

Sidebar header

Essentials Rating Identity Location Details Activity History Survey

Narrow with icons

Icons can be added to the narrow sidebar to help make the links more easily recognizable.

Alerts Ratings Location Profile

Off-canvas filters

A sidebar can be used for more than just a navigation menu. This example shows how to create a filter panel using several different components together.
